JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA MONDAY, THE 8TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 18TH POUSHA, 1939 Crl.MC.No. 6888 of 2017 CRIME NO. 571/2017 OF BEKAL POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD DISTRICT PETITIONER (S) /ACCUSED_ : 1 SHARATHLAL P.K., S/O.SATHYANARAYANAN, AGED 22 YEARS, KOORANGARA HOUSE, KALLIOT, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. 2 SREEKUMAR K. @ BAVA, AGED 28 YEARS, S/O.KRISHNAN P., KANIMKUNDU HOUSE, PALLIKKARA (VIA), PERIYA P.O., KASARAGOD DISTRICT. 3 SIVARAU P., AGED 18 YEARS, S/O.RAJAN K.V., KOORANGARA HOUSE, KALLIOT, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. 4 MAHESH V., AGED 27 YEARS, S/O.BHASKARAN, PARAPPAKKETTU HOUSE, KALLIOT, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. 5 NIBIN A., AGED 19 YEARS, S/O.LATE BALAKRISHNAN, KOORANGARA HOUSE, KALLIOT, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. 6 SANOOP P., AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.JANARDHANAN, KOORANGARA HOUSE, KALLIOT, KANHIRADUKAM P.O., PERIYA VILLAGE, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. 7 KRIPESH, AGED 17 YEARS, S/O.KRISHNAN, KALLIOT HOUSE, KALLIOT, KASARGOD DISTRICT. 8 JANARDHANAN A., AGED 29 YEARS, S/O.THAMBI, PULLUMALA HOUSE, KALLIOT, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. BY ADVS.SRI.M.SASINDRAN SRI.P.K.SUBHASH RESPONDENT (S) /COMPLAINANT & STATE: 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682 031. 2/- se ee eee a 2018/KER/716 Cr1.MC.No. 6888 of 2017 2. OMANAKUTTAN, AGED 52 YEARS, S/O.NARAYANAN, KANNADIPPARA HOUSE, KALLIOT, KANJIRADUKKAM P.O., PERIYA VILLAGE, KASARAGOD-671 121. Ri BY SR PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.B.JAYASURYA R2 BY ADV. SRI.S.R.SREEJITH THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 08-01-2018,THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: sts eats ees 2018/KER/716 Crl.MC.No. 6888 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER (S) ' ANNEXURES: ANNEXURE AT A TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO.571 OF 2017 OF BAKEL POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. ANNEXURE AIT A TRUE COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT SWORN TO BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT ENDORSING THE FACTUM OF COMPOUNDING OF THE ABOVE SAID OFFENCES AND THE SETTLEMENT OF DISPUTES BETWEEN THE PARTIES. RESPONDENT'S ANNEXURES: NIL /TRUE COPY/ P.A.TO JUDGE sts 2018/KER/716 B.KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 8" day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioners are accused in Crime No.571 of 2017 of the Bekal Police Station, registered for the offences punishable under Sections 143, 147, 148, 452 and 427 IPC read with Section 149 IPC. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably seitled between the parties. 3. On going through the facts and circumstances of the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be settled. lt has been reported that no criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioners. The defacto complainant has filed Annexure-All affidavit affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between him and the petitioners and he has no complaints against the petitioners. Considering the fact that the matter has already been settled amicably between the parties, this court is satisfied that no purpose would be served in proceeding with the trial of the 2018/KER/716 Crl.M.C.No.6888 of 2017 2 case. Matters being so, Annexure-Al First Information Report in Crime No.571 of 2017 of the Bekal Police Station, and all further proceedings in it, as against the petitioners, are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-Al First Information Report in Crime No.571 of 2017 of the Bekal Police Station, and all further proceedings in it, as against the petitioners, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA JUDGE DSV/8/1/18 // True Copy / P.A.To Judge
